intro: Anarrhinum, commonly known as the false flax, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species that are native to regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plants typically have slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. Anarrhinum species are often found in moist or calcareous soils, growing in meadows, woodland edges, and along riverbanks. They produce small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family.
